titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: David Watts Hulings was a lawyer and state legislator (1825-1826) of Lewiston, Pennsylvania. Hulings' activities extended to real estate, road and canal development, and the iron industry, as owner of Hope Furnace.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of professional and business records of David Hulings. The papers include correspondence, articles of agreements, and bills and receipts. The collection also includes a candid essay to his son, Thomas, on setting up in business and beginning married life. Correspondents include John Bioren, Abraham Brindley, William E. Hulings, James Irvin, George S. Irvine, W. R. Maclay, William McClure, W. Patton, Charles B. Penrose, John Porter, John Rea, and William Worrell.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of Anna D. Moyerman.
